channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Vice President Vance hosts Charlie Kirk's podcast, talks about his political legacy
item.description: Vice President Vance, who credits Charlie Kirk with his political rise, hosted Kirk's podcast Monday and talked about carrying on his friend's political mantle.

item.title: Sen. Chris Murphy discusses the canceling of critics of Charlie Kirk and free speech
item.description: Sen. Chris Murphy, D-Conn., talks about the cancel culture that has followed Charlie Kirk's assassination and what it means for free speech.

item.title: Officials push back against Trump's threats to deploy National Guard in Baltimore
item.description: President Trump has threatened to expand his campaign to combat crime into other cities, including Baltimore. But the city's mayor and Maryland's governor -- both Democrats -- are pushing back.

item.title: Protests threaten to overshadow President Trump's U.K. state visit
item.description: President Trump will arrive in the U.K. Tuesday night for a rare second state visit. But protests threaten to overshadow all the planned pomp and pageantry.

item.title: Israel's military says its begun expanded operation in Gaza City
item.description: The Israeli military says its expanded operation in Gaza City "to destroy Hamas' military infrastructure" has begun, forcibly displacing hundreds of thousands of people.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Vance says he will carry on Charlie Kirk's political legacy, FBI director to testify before Congress amid questions about his leadership, Trump tries to reshape Fed leadership, ahead of a key vote

item.title: Ed Sheeran talks about his new album 'Play'
item.description: NPR talks to pop superstar Ed Sheeran about his new album, "Play."

item.title: Trump says U.S. military struck a boat allegedly carrying drugs from Venezuela
item.description: The U.S. military struck a Venezuelan boat for the second time Monday, killing three people. President Trump says the vessel was carrying drugs to the United States.

item.title: Books about slavery could be removed from NPS museums, gift shops
item.description: The Trump administration ordered the National Park Service to remove any books from its museums or gift shops that cast America in a negative light. That could include stories about slavery.

item.title: Lawmakers race to strike funding deal as threat of government shutdown looms
item.description: Congress has two weeks to strike a funding deal and avoid a government shutdown. But tensions are high amid a debate on political violence, complicating their path.
